titleStmt.title: Letter of Philip Arabicus and Philip II to Aelius Aemilianus

msContents.summary: Rescript to the prefect of the Vigiles that grants early discharge to a member of the Vigiles on the grounds of his ill health. There follows a summary of the soldier’s postings.

origin.origDate: Between 21 June 248 and September or October 249

div.ab: Emperor Caesar M. Ilius Philippus Pius Felix Augustus and Emperor Caesar M. Iulius Philippus Pius Felix Augustus send greetings to Aleius Aemilianus. We wish that, in the second Philippian cohort of the vigiles, the century of Martialis, which you have in your care, dearest Aemilianus, on account of the poor state of his physical health M. Aurelius Mucianus, son of Marcus, be released from his sworn service. M. Aurelius Mucianus, son of Marcus, from Moesia Inferior, in the second Philippian cohort of vigiles, who was recruited in the consulship of Gordian and Aviola [239] and made a soldier on the 13th day before the kalends of July [18 June] by the prefect Celsus; he was sent to Ostia to a vexillatio on the ides of April [13 April] in the consulship of Gordian II and Pompeianus [241] and was returned on the ides of August [13 August] in the aforewritten consulship; he was sent away to the East on the 9th day before the kalends of September [23 August] in the consulship of Gordian II and Pompeianus [241] and was returned on the 9th day before the kalends of January [23 December] in the consulship of Peregrinus and Aemilianus [244]; he was sent away to Sardinia on the 17th day before the kalends of September [15 August] in the consulship of Philip Augustus and Titianus [245] and was returned on the 5th day before the kalends of June [28 May] in the aforewritten consulship; he was sent away to Luna and Pisa on the ides of April [13 April] in the consulship of Praesens and Albinus [246] and was returned on the 10th day before the kalends of July [21 June] in the consulship of the two Philips [247 or 248]; inscribed as a recipient of the public wheat supply on the kalends of March [1 March] in the consulship of Arrianus and Papus [243], he received his allotment of wheat on the 22nd day at the 12th gate.
